During a recent appearance on Steve Bannon’s War Room, Arizona gubernatorial candidate Kari Lake was asked by Bannon whether Governor Doug Ducey is prepared for the fallout of ending Title 42.
The show host asked whether Lake, if elected as governor, would participate in the same performative politics around the border and claims a lack of authority has their hands tied.
“We do have the authority and it’s right there in the Constitution, Article 1, Section 10 – we’re being invaded and we have the right to protect our people and protect our country.
As of tomorrow, if the CDC pulls this Title 42, we’re going to see an explosion of people coming across the border and they do have the ability to do this.
I mean think about the invasion as we’ve seen it so far with over two million people coming across our border, many people say that’s a low estimate.
Lake responded that she would crack down on border enforcement, saying the authority for states to protect their border does indeed exist.
